bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from W.H. Lowdermilk & Co. to Philip Showalter Hench, December 1, 1941

div1.p: Lowdermilk acknowledges Hench's book request and informs him which publications are available.

div1.head: Letter from W.H. Lowdermilk & Co. to Philip Showalter Hench, December 1, 1941
div1.opener:
UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT PUBLICATIONS A SPECIALTY
W. H. LOWDERMILK & COMPANY
OLD CHOICE AND RARE BOOKS
NEW BOOKS SUPPLIED ON ORDER
835 545
1418 F Street, Northwest
WASHINGTON, D. C. Dec. 1, 1941.
Phone, National 0613
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
# 2821
1450
(added 504 for
camge)
Dear Sir,
div1.p:
In reply to your inquiry of Nov. 21.
We can supply the following.

Report on the origin and and spread of
Typhoid Fever in U. S. Military Camps during the
Spanish War of 1898, by Reed, Baughn, and Shakespeare
2 vols. quarto and folio cloth bound Washington 1904
$800

I wilReport of Maj. Gen. Brooke, U. S. Army,
Military Gov. of Cuba, in Annual report of U. S. War
Dept. 1899. vol. 1 part 6 - 8 vo. cloth 868 pages $300

Havana Yellow Fever Comm. Report 1879 in the
Annual Report of U. S. Nat. Health Board of Health
1880. Wash. 1881- 8 vo. cloth $300

The above are all in good condition, prices
are net including delivery.

In regard to the other items which you inquire
for. These reports range from 6 to 12 volumes each
and we think it is likely that you wish only one
volume from each.

If you can let us know just what in-
formation you are seeking we may be able
to offer the book containing it for the various
years separately.
